page.title: 17NEWICK BONFIRE SOCIETY
page.content: Early in the 20th century, lads of the village banded together into a bonfife society and held bonfire nights that were rough, noisy and hazardous. Torchlight processions included people on horseback, banners were carried and fireworks, known as Newick Rousers, made in the local bakery, were set off. Today the Bonfire Society is in much more sensible hands. The torchlight procession, bonfire and fireworks on the Green are an exciting event in the year for Newick children.The Society works hard throughout the year, raising money to pay for costumes and fireworks, and all the money collected on the night (always the Saturday before 5th Nov. to avoid clashing with the Lewes cele- brations) goes to charity.
